description: From Middle English beschrewen (“to curse, pervert”), equivalent to be- +‎ shrew.

verbs.description: beshrew (third-person singular simple present beshrews, present participle beshrewing, simple past and past participle beshrewed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To invoke or wish evil upon; to curse.
(transitive) An imperative uttered as a mildly imprecatory or merely expletive introductory exclamation.
